# children

**Instance Property**

An array of view controllers that are hierarchical children of the view controller.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var children: [NSViewController] { get set }
```

## Discussion

You can add or remove child view controllers by using this property. When you do, the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSViewController/addChild(_:)] or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSViewController/removeFromParent()] method gets called accordingly.

## Managing Child View Controllers in a Custom Container

- **addChild(_:)**: A convenience method for adding a child view controller at the end of the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSViewController/children] array.
- **transition(from:to:options:completionHandler:)**: Performs a transition between two sibling child view controllers of the view controller.
- **insertChild(_:at:)**: Inserts a specified child view controller into the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSViewController/children] array at a specified position.
- **removeChild(at:)**: Removes a specified child controller from the view controller.
- **removeFromParent()**: Removes the called view controller from its parent view controller.
- **preferredContentSizeDidChange(for:)**: Called when there is a change in value of the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSViewController/preferredContentSize] property of a child view controller or a presented view controller.
